etymology.description: 好 good + 久 long (time) + 不 not + 见 see = haven’t seen for a long time.
etymology.interpretation: Expresses that people have not seen each other for a long period; used as a friendly greeting upon meeting again.
etymology.simplification: 见 is the simplified form of 見, reduced to fewer strokes during script reform to ease writing of this high-frequency verb.

parts.english: long (time); for a long time; long-standing; a long while
to see; to meet; to appear; to perceive

examples.chinese: 好久不见(好久不見)，我们去喝杯咖啡吧(我們去喝杯咖啡吧)。
examples.pinyin: Hǎojiǔ bújiàn, wǒmen qù hē bēi kāfēi ba.
examples.english: Long time no see, let's grab a coffee.

examples.chinese: 大家好久不见(大家好久不見)，都变得更成熟了(都變得更成熟了)。
examples.pinyin: Dàjiā hǎojiǔ bújiàn, dōu biàn de gèng chéngshú le.
examples.english: We all haven’t seen each other for a long time; everyone has become more mature.
